projects.title: Modeling interfaces in granular media using physics informed neural networks
projects.abstract: This project brings together the LEMTA laboratory (Nancy, France), the LMRS laboratory (Rouen, France) and the LITIS laboratory, around physics-informed machine learning paradigm for modeling interfaces in granular media. The main focus is to propose new theoretical insights and new physics-informed learning methods through the study of granular media modelisation.

projects.title: Laboratoire Commun LITIS Saagie
projects.abstract: This project is a joint laboratory between LITIS and the company Saagie, which aims to develop AI models within a general framework of multitask statistical learning and regularization for the use of incomplete data.

projects.title: Multimodal/multiview learning applied to real problems
projects.abstract: MMLARP is a scientific-technological cooperation program that involves more than 20 researchers from Brazil, Chile and France. Its aim is to strengthen the consortium's current collaborations around multimodal/multiview learning paradigms, for applications in medical image analysis, document image retrieval and automotive safety.
